item.title: Impact Investing in Africa
item.author: Dike Dijemeni,Esuabom Dijemeni,
item.description: According to The Global Impact Investing Network (GIIN), impact investment can be defined as investment made into companies, organisations, and funds with the intention to generate social and environmental impact alongside a financial return. Hence, impact investing in Africa is the deployment of …

item.title: Electronic and Algorithmic Trading: Fixed Income Securities
item.author: Dike Dijemeni,Esuabom Dijemeni,
item.description: Electronic trading has become an increasingly important part of the fixed income market landscape in recent years. The rise of electronic trading has enabled a pickup of automated trading (including algorithmic and high-frequency trading) in fixed income futures and parts of cash bond markets. These …

item.title: Risk in Investment Management and Financial Services Part 1 :Credit Risk
item.author: Esuabom Dijemeni,
item.description: The objective of this series, Risk in Investment Management and Financial Services, is to provide a top-level introduction to risk in investment management and financial services. item.title: Valuation of Medical Technology Start-Ups
item.author: Dike Dijemeni,Esuabom Dijemeni,
item.description: In the past, industry specific start-up “rules of thumb” may have been sufficient to serve as reasonable basis for any valuation concern. Combined with the unique market dynamics and regulatory environment associated with the medical technology industry, start-ups in this field present a unique set …
